bug.body: https://plus.google.com/101476109917392419132/posts/5upcf4NNcxP

bug.title: Music controls next/prev buttons issue with AntennaPod
bug.body: AntennaPod (F-Droid or Google Play) has an option to have the next/prev buttons skip forward/backward so many seconds rather than skip to the next/prev track. With your music controls, It seems to skip a track AND jump ahead so many seconds with one press. The native Android lock screen music controls obey the AntennaPod setting and only skip seconds, not next track. Could you take a look at this and match the behaviour of the stock lock screen controls? Thanks

bug.title: Plugin issues
bug.body: https://plus.google.com/102562765326041875459/posts/47KQhwdPvYr

bug.title: Home button to unlock never working
bug.body: I have a non-rooted Samsung Galaxy s6 that runs Android 7. The home button to unlock feature stopped working after I restarted my phone. I have tried everything such as uninstalling the app restarting then reinstalling and it still won't work. Please fix this.

bug.title: Black Screen
bug.body: I like the app but there is just one thing that happen. Have been using the app for months but it only happen once (Just know). The Always on screen is showing but when I close it to open the phone only a black screen shows. I lock my phone (Using the power button) to try it again but the same thing happens. I tried opening via Power button or home button but it is still the same. To fix this I removed the battery and restart the phone. This will be a major issue for people with unremovable battery. Holding the power button doesn't work. Android will show options like "Power Off", "Restart" and more, but nothing occur.

bug.title: Always On Display AMOLED always on issue
bug.body: I'm using XiaoMi Mi3, this app is great app but it keep on turning on & won't turn off the screen. It should be raise to wave, then only will wake up but it's not, it keeps on forever. I already set the "stop always on automatically rules to disabled", "raise to wave" to enabled, "always on work for charging & discharging" & "always on display works for battery 20% & above"; but the screen still always on regardless wave or not waving on the proximity sensor. Please fix this issue as soonest because it drain my phone battery super fast from 100% to 35% for 6 hours (this is unacceptable) Thanks

bug.title: "Raise To Wake" Flashing Lock Screen for .5ish seconds after 10 second timeout.
bug.body: App runs perfectly otherwise, but when raise to wake is activated, the end of the 10 second raise to wake timer flashes the whole lock screen for a half ish second, which is bright and distracting and ruins any battery saving that might have been done with the 10 second partial AMOLED activation. Done with app version 0.96 beta, Galaxy S6, Android 6.0.1. Tried turning off developer screen animations (for the tube fadeout) and many iterations of options but bug persists.

bug.title: Turns on and off
bug.body: The app display goes on and off i.e for about a minute I have the time screen enabled and the next I'm on the lock screen. Device: Xiaomi Redmi 2 Android version: 5.1 Method to turn off the display: Double tap (nothing else) Pocket mode: On SU permissions: Yes Greenify Integration: On

bug.title: Light keys should reset to user defaulted setting when the AOD stops
bug.body: Currently it sets the timeout to 1.5 seconds

bug.title: Cannot complete permission setup on SM-T700
bug.body: I have a Samsung Tab S 7.0" (SM-T700) on Android 6.0, when I get to the stage "Modify System Settings" when I click on the "Allow Now" button it takes me to the WiFi section of the Settings menu. I have gone into the settings and allowed Always On AMOLED to be a device administrator and I allowed Notification Access but when I try hitting the checkmark on the final stage, it says "Please allow all permissions" What else do I need to do? This seems like a bug.

bug.title: System UI crashed after plugin installed
bug.body:
Not running a custom ROM, phone is rooted. Currently running 5.0.2. > I managed to fix the issue, but this is a pretty crucial problem that might cause some people inconvenience. > > I am using a Galaxy S6 (SM_G920A). > > I insralled the Always On AMOLED apk and started the service and installed the hardware button disable plugin for the app. After installing, the Always On AMOLED app process crashed and my screen shut off. Since the plugin was also installed, I couldn't turn on the screen or enter recovery mode. My phone was pretty much in a bricked state, but the notification LED would still blink. > > After calling myself from a different phone, the screen finally lit up, showing that the System UI stopped, and from there I could disable the Always On AMOLED service. > > I just wanted to let you know about this issue. Sorry for the inconvenience. ## ## Device info:

bug.title: Issues with proximity sensor on Samsung devices
Notifications show null
bug.body: An SMS notification shows null for me, might be a permissions issue

bug.title: Analog clocks displaying the wrong time
Notification content preview doesn't work in horizontal mode
Watchface pops up when pressing power button twice to open camera on Nexus devices
bug.body: The Always on Screen gets activated when pressing the power button twice, which is the shortcut to open the camera on Nexus devices (tested on my 6P). The camera starts up and the phone vibrates as usual, but the watchface pops up and blocks the screen. The user has to press the power button twice again to make the camera app appear.

bug.title: Brightness isn't being set back to original 100% of the time
bug.body: As reported by Joseph Fountain in the Google Plus community > I am not sure what triggers it, but the screen brightness change seems to stick sometimes when you open the phone, I have the brightness set to zero, and sometimes when I unlock the system brightness stays at zero, not sure if this is intentionalÔªø

bug.title: Force close caused while refreshing notifications
bug.body: ``` java.util.ConcurrentModificationException at java.util.HashMap$HashIterator.nextEntry(HashMap.java:787) at java.util.HashMap$EntryIterator.next(HashMap.java:824) at java.util.HashMap$EntryIterator.next(HashMap.java:824) at com.tomer.alwayson.Services.MainService.refresh(MainService.java:202) at com.tomer.alwayson.Services.MainService.access$200(MainService.java:42) at com.tomer.alwayson.Services.MainService$3.run(MainService.java:218) at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:739) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:95) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:148) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5422) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:726) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:616) ```

bug.title: Dismiss service when the alarm goes off
Notifications enabled by default, but doesn't ask for permission on first launch
Disables auto brightness after turning on.
Overheats and drains too much battery on some devices
bug.body: Should find a way to lock the screen when not in use. As well as maybe getting doze to work while the app is running on rooted devices. Kind or related to #22

bug.title: haptic feedback not working
bug.body: https://reddit.com/r/Android/comments/4nimzg/app_i_created_an_always_on_app_for_amoled/d44er3w?context=3

bug.title: Home button doesn't work on Samsung devices.
bug.body: Home button should turn on the display and dismiss the app.

bug.title: Service stops when app is not running in background
bug.body: Users reported that the service stops working after clearing the app from recents or not opening it.

bug.title: Capacitive buttons light up on Samsung devices
